intro: Stenodraba suffruticosa, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems that are often covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a delicate touch to its otherwise desolate habitat. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted for water storage, and it thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils. Stenodraba suffruticosa is an important component of desert ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various small fauna.
